definition: gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: In diplomatic language, the phrase is normally taken to mean spying.
sentences.chinese: 在外交语言上，这句话的意思通常是指间谍活动。

sentences.english: They were forced to suspend their espionage activities after their identities were compromised.
sentences.chinese: 在身份泄露后，他们被迫搁置了自己的间谍活动。

sentences.english: It engages in espionage and terrorism with Isreal.
sentences.chinese: 它从事对以色列的间谍活动和恐怖主义。
更具体地说，网络间谍活动。

sentences.english: Every counter intelligence faces such happening all around the globe.
sentences.chinese: 全球反情报人员都要面对间谍活动。

sentences.english: But espionage is only one worry.
sentences.chinese: 不过，间谍活动还只是忧虑之一。

sentences.english: Neither was there any hint of espionage in Hanley's early life.
sentences.chinese: 汉利的早期生活也毫无进行间谍活动的迹象。

sentences.english: But spying left plenty of time to sample the local cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 但间谍活动却让他有大量的时间来研究地方菜。

sentences.english: The basis of spycraft is breaking the rules without being noticed.
sentences.chinese: 间谍活动的基要就是在对方浑然不觉时打破规则。

sentences.english: The trade name for this type of spying is the "honey trap."
sentences.chinese: 这类间谍活动美其名曰“美人计”。

sentences.english: Before they could carry out acts of sabotage or espionage they were apprehended.
sentences.chinese: 他们尚未从事破坏活动或间谍活动即被逮捕。

sentences.english: He was accused of spying and declared non grata.
sentences.chinese: 他被控从事间谍活动而被宣布为不受欢迎。

sentences.english: This type of industrial espionage is prevalent in the defense-related industries.
sentences.chinese: 这种类型的工业间谍活动在国防工业内十分普遍。

sentences.english: Perfect Dark Zero plunges players into a world of corporate espionage and conspiracy.
sentences.chinese: 完美黑暗零陷入了企业间谍活动和阴谋的世界球员。

definition: US Central Intelligence Agency, CIA/abbr. for 中央情報局|中央情报局[Zhong1 yang1 Qing2 bao4 ju2]
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
secret service/special service/secret service agent/special agent
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
